newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Oct 21.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Oct 21.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:

Fosters Brewing Group Ltd said its 40 percent owned Canadian brewer, Molson Breweries, had agreed to discuss a new licensing deal with Coors Brewing Co after a court ruling terminated their previous agreement. Foster's said it was too early to assess the financial ramifications of the ruling.

Property investment group Hudson Conway Ltd announced on Monday plans to issue A$120 million of five-year unsecured notes with detachable five-year options. The issue, which aims to give the company greater financial flexibility, will be fully underwritten by Prudential Bache Securities and will be placed with institutional investors, chairman Sir Roderick Carnegie told the annual meeting. It also said it hoped to achieve a higher profit in the current year ending June 30, although the property market remained flat.

Israeli tax authorities said on Sunday they had raided the offices of a company controlled by media magnate Rupert Murdoch and removed documents. News Datacom Research Ltd, a Jerusalem-based company controlled by Murdoch's News Corp, forcefully denied any wrongdoing. "The company is suspected of concealing income in the years 1989-1996 of some US$150 million," the tax authority said in a statement. News also said its its News America Holdings Inc unit would redeem on December 15, 1996 all of the outstanding December 15, 2001, 12 percent senior notes at the redemption price of 106 percent of the principal together with accrued and unpaid interest up to December 15, 1996.

Cortecs International Ltd said on Friday in London it was unaware of the reason for the drop in the company's share price. Earlier, the Daily Mail reported that market bears were talking the stock down to 100p, saying "beware of bad news". The newspaper did not give further details. The biotech's shares fell 9-1/2 to 195-1/2 in afternoon trade in London, after falling 15p to 205p on Thursday.
The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission (ACCC) will not oppose the proposed acquisition of Primac Holdings Ltd by IAMA Ltd, acting ACCC chairman Allan Asher said on Sunday.

Trade in the shares of Perth-based electronics and telecommunications equipment manufacturer ERG Australia Ltd halted on Monday morning pending an announcement. Before the halt ERG's shares fell 13 cents to A$1.12 on heavy volume.
